name: California Consumer Privacy Act
summary: The CCPA gives California residents the right to know what personal information is collected, used, shared, or sold, both offline and online. It provides rights to delete personal information, opt-out of the sale of personal information, and non-discrimination for exercising these rights.

articles.title: Right to know about personal information collected
articles.summary: Businesses must inform consumers about the categories of personal information collected, the purposes for which it is used, and the categories of third parties with whom it is shared.
articles.notes: Privacy policies must be clear and comprehensive, updated at least annually.

articles.title: Right to delete personal information
articles.summary: Consumers have the right to request that businesses delete personal information collected from them, subject to certain exceptions such as completing transactions or complying with legal obligations.
articles.notes: Businesses must have processes to handle deletion requests within 45 days.

articles.title: Right to opt-out of sale of personal information
articles.summary: Consumers have the right to opt-out of the sale of their personal information. Businesses must provide a clear and conspicuous link on their homepage titled 'Do Not Sell My Personal Information'.
articles.notes: Opt-out mechanisms must be easy to use and respect consumer choices.

articles.title: Notice of right to opt-out
articles.summary: Businesses that sell personal information must provide notice to consumers about their right to opt-out and must not sell personal information after receiving an opt-out request.
articles.notes: Opt-out requests must be honored within 15 business days.

developer_guidance: Implement user interfaces for consumers to submit access, deletion, and opt-out requests
Maintain detailed records of what personal information is collected, from whom, and how it is used
Implement data mapping to track personal information flows across systems and third parties
Provide clear privacy notices that explain data collection and usage practices
Implement opt-out mechanisms that are easy to find and use
Establish processes to verify consumer identity before processing requests
Implement systems to honor opt-out requests and prevent sale of opted-out consumers' data
Ensure deletion processes remove personal information from all systems, backups, and third parties
Implement non-discrimination policies - do not penalize consumers for exercising their rights
Maintain audit trails of all consumer requests and responses
Update privacy policies at least annually and notify consumers of material changes
Train customer service staff on handling CCPA requests appropriately
